GetCanvasPosition(InputStateContext, PointerEventArgs)

Gets the current pointer position in canvas coordinates.

[Obsolete("Use GetTypedCanvasPosition() instead. The typed method works in both Visual Tree and Direct Rendering modes.")]
protected static Point GetCanvasPosition(InputStateContext context, PointerEventArgs e)

Parameters

context InputStateContext
e PointerEventArgs

Returns

Point

Remarks

DEPRECATED: Use GetTypedCanvasPosition(InputStateContext, PointerEventArgs) instead. This method only works correctly in Visual Tree mode. The typed method handles both rendering modes correctly.

GetPointerPoint(InputStateContext, PointerEventArgs)

Gets the pointer point for button state information.

protected static PointerPoint GetPointerPoint(InputStateContext context, PointerEventArgs e)

Parameters

context InputStateContext
e PointerEventArgs

Returns

PointerPoint

GetScreenPosition(InputStateContext, PointerEventArgs)

Gets the current pointer position relative to the root panel (viewport coordinates).

[Obsolete("Use GetTypedViewportPosition() instead. Returns typed ViewportPoint that prevents coordinate confusion.")]
protected static Point GetScreenPosition(InputStateContext context, PointerEventArgs e)

Parameters

context InputStateContext
e PointerEventArgs

Returns

Point

Remarks

DEPRECATED: Use GetTypedViewportPosition(InputStateContext, PointerEventArgs) instead. This method returns an untyped Avalonia.Point which doesn't indicate whether it's in canvas or viewport coordinates, making it easy to accidentally pass to the wrong conversion method.

GetTypedCanvasPosition(InputStateContext, PointerEventArgs)

Gets the current pointer position in canvas coordinates.

protected static CanvasPoint GetTypedCanvasPosition(InputStateContext context, PointerEventArgs e)

Parameters

context InputStateContext
e PointerEventArgs

Returns

CanvasPoint

Remarks

This is the preferred method for getting pointer positions when you need canvas coordinates. It uses the type-safe coordinate system and works correctly in both Visual Tree and Direct Rendering modes.

Use canvas coordinates for:

  • Hit testing on the canvas
  • Node/edge positions
  • Selection box bounds
  • Any position that needs to be stored or compared with node data

GetTypedViewportPosition(InputStateContext, PointerEventArgs)

Gets the current pointer position in viewport coordinates.

protected static ViewportPoint GetTypedViewportPosition(InputStateContext context, PointerEventArgs e)

Parameters

context InputStateContext
e PointerEventArgs

Returns

ViewportPoint

Remarks

This is the preferred method for getting pointer positions when you need viewport coordinates. It uses the type-safe coordinate system and works correctly in both Visual Tree and Direct Rendering modes.

Use viewport coordinates for:

  • Pan calculations (delta from last position)
  • Auto-pan edge detection
  • UI overlay positioning
  • Any position relative to the visible screen area

HitTestCanvas(InputStateContext, Point)

Performs hit testing on the main canvas. The position must be in canvas coordinates (use GetCanvasPosition, not GetScreenPosition).

protected static IInputElement? HitTestCanvas(InputStateContext context, Point canvasPosition)

Parameters

context InputStateContext
canvasPosition Point

Returns

IInputElement

HitTestForPort(InputStateContext, Point)

Performs hit testing on the main canvas specifically for finding ports. Skips edge paths and markers that might be blocking the port. The position must be in canvas coordinates.

protected static Control? HitTestForPort(InputStateContext context, Point canvasPosition)

Parameters

context InputStateContext
canvasPosition Point

Returns

Control
